timeline.bodyText:
Can you please review this method? I don't like that it is named add... but the values to add are fields.
I would prefer one of the following:

Use a field for KieSession too and rename the method like init()
Add pmml4Result and unwrappedInputParams as parameters too
Keep the method as it is but rename it as initKieSession

Wdyt?
timeline.author: danielezonca

replies.bodyText:
@danielezonca
For one reason or another none of the above suggestions satisfy me by themselves, but I think I get the point.
I've refactored/simplified the class a little bit: removed "state" of the class; put as much initialization as possible inside the constructor; etc.
I still keep the method name "addObjectsToSession" because I think it is exactly what the method does - "initKieSession" looks a little bit misleading with this refactoring.
replies.author: gitgabrio

replies.bodyText: I had a look to method after the refactoring and I don't like that now the KieSession is created together with the builder but it is fine for now. We will probably have to change/adapt this code in the future so I would like not to spend other time on it now :)
replies.author: danielezonca

timeline.bodyText: Please handle this exception properly.
timeline.author: jiripetrlik

replies.bodyText:
@jiripetrlik
TBH, this method is for development only - I'm not expecting rules to be dumped every time and I will remove it soon before merge (I'll add a TODO for this). Moreover, the only reasonable way I see to deal with it it would be to just ignore it, because I do not care at all if the "dump" does not work for some reason - what I'm concerned about is if the actual execution fails. Does this make sense? Do you have some suggestion?
replies.author: gitgabrio

replies.bodyText:
@gitgabrio
I think that if you plan to remove it before PR is ready it is not a problem. In general I think it is good to rethrow in RuntimeException.
replies.author: jiripetrlik

replies.bodyText:
👍
Perfectly agree: my plan is to remove that development-only code
replies.author: gitgabrio
